resources.string: Linear fit: y = a x + b
As you are closing the interactive mode of this graph, you can select if you want to keep your zoom.
Visit phyphox.org to create more advanced experiments including data analysis and share them with colleagues, students and friends.
Buffer size (number of values to be stored)
Sensor rate (in Hz, 0 = as fast as possible)
This device provides its own phyphox experiment. Select "load from device" to open it.
Scan a QR code that contains a phyphox experiment.
Could not find a QR code that contains a phyphox experiment.
The QR code you just scanned does not seem to match to the previous codes. Please make sure to only scan the codes belonging to the same experiment.
The QR code you just scanned is part of a set of
codes. Please press continue to scan the remaining codes. Codes still missing:
Invalid checksum. This means that either the QR code is bad or something went wrong while scanning it.
The transmitted experiment data is corrupted.

Phyphox will use the first language available from your preferred languages list. To change your preferences, go to your Android \"settings\" below. To learn which languages are available and how you can help, select \"visit website\".
The device info has been copied to your clipboard.

Please be careful not to damage your phone while experimenting. Please take special care to avoid dropping it on hard surfaces and do not expose it to excessive magnetic fields. The authors of phyphox are not responsible for any damage to your phone.
phyphox® has been created at the 2nd Institute of Physics at the RWTH Aachen University.

Development and Concept:
 Dr. Sebastian Staacks
 Concept:
 Prof. Christoph Stampfer
 Programming:
 Dominik Dorsel
 Jonas Gessner
 Camilla Lummerzheim

Phyphox® is open source software released under the GNU General Public Licence. Please visit http://phyphox.org for further information and to get access to its source code. However, the name \"phyphox\" and \"RWTH Aachen\" are registered trademarks.

The web-interface for remote access uses the JavaScript library \"Chart.js\" (http://chartjs.org), available under the MIT licence. For the fourier transform, we use the FFTW library (http://fftw.org), Copyright © 2003, 2007-11 Matteo Frigo, Copyright © 2003, 2007-11 Massachusetts Institute of Technology, which is available under the GNU General Public Licence (version 2 or later). GPS elevation data is converted from the WGS84 ellipsoid to the EGM84 geoid using EGM84 data (30\' resolution) and a ported function from the GographicLib (https://geographiclib.sourceforge.io/, MIT/X11 licence).

Apache POI
Copyright 2003-2015 The Apache Software Foundation

This product contains the chunks_parse_cmds.tbl file from the vsdump program. Copyright (C) 2006-2007 Valek Filippov (frob@df.ru)

does not report the correct sensor type. It appears to be vendor-specific and we could only guess its type from its name. Therefore, it might not work as expected.
is not available. Usually this means, that your device simply does not have this type of sensor.
Do you want to delete this experiment from your collection?
Leave this experiment and discard recorded data?
This experiment configuration does not define any data to be exported. If this is an error, please contact the source of the QR code or configuration file.

You are about to enable remote access to the acquired data. You should only do so on a trusted network! Also note, that direct access between devices may not be possible on many corporate or university networks.

For best security and performance you should connect to this device via a tethering option (mobile hotspot).

After pressing ok, you can access your measurement from any web browser on the same network.
You need to set up a Wifi connection to the remote device first. Please enable Wifi or create a mobile hotspot.
Remote access enabled. Access this experiment from the following URL: \n%1$s

The color plot in the remote interface is only an approximation. In contrast to the in-app plot, at the moment it cannot handle non-equidistant data or logarithmic scaling on the x and y axis. So, data at varying intervals may appear at the wrong location.
This experiment has been opened from a remote source. Do you want to add it to your experiment collection?
You can save the state of this experiment including your data to your collection or share it with a third-party app.
State has been saved to your collection.
This resource contains multiple experiments. You can either pick one to open it and optionally save it to your collection or use the button below to save them all to your collection at once.
The following experiments for your device are available from phyphox. You can either just open and use them or add them all to your collection to easily access them from the main menu.
Pick the data sets to export.
There are new options to support phyphox at the bottom of the list.
Check experiment info to learn how to use this experiment.
Touch the triangle to start the experiment.
Bluetooth Low Energy is not supported on Android Versions lower than 4.3.

Android requires a location permission for Bluetooth scans as the result could be used to derive location information. We will now request these permissions. You need to grant them in order to do a Bluetooth scan.

In addition to the permission to get location information, Android requires location services to be enabled for Bluetooth scans as the result could be used to derive location information. We will redirect you to your system settings.
Bluetooth is disabled. Please enable bluetooth and try again.
Bluetooth connection could not be opened.
The notification for the characteristic with the UUID
Turning on notifications for the Characteristic with the UUID
The Bluetooth device is not connected. Experiment can not be started.
The Bluetooth device has been disconnected.
There is an error with the Bluetooth device.
Error while writing characteristic with UUID
Error while reading characteristic with UUID
Error while discovering the services of the bluetooth device.
The reading operation was not successful.
The writing operation was not successful.
If your device is not supported, pick \"more info\" to learn more about the flexible Bluetooth Low Energy support in phyphox on our website.

This experiment uses a network connection, which means that experiment data can be transmitted to a network service. You can find more details by clicking the privacy policy button below, which will take you to a website with a privacy policy provided by the creator of this experiment. If the network service is not a local device, you should be aware that phyphox may transmit the following information if you start this experiment:
An id that is unique to this device and the network service, which allow to match all data send from this device through this experiment configuration.
Recordings or data derived from recordings from the microphone.
Detailed information about the model of your device and/or the version of phyphox.
Technical details about the following sensors:
